content.question: The scientist notes that this reaction involves a high-energy gamma ray photon. In what way is the photon associated with this reaction?

choices.label: An electron transitions to a higher allowed energy state and absorbs a photon of this energy difference.
An electron transitions to a lower allowed energy state and emits a photon of this energy difference.
A nucleus transitions to a higher energy state and absorbs a photon of this energy difference.
A nucleus transitions to a lower energy state and emits a photon of this energy difference.

content.answer: A nucleus transitions to a lower energy state and emits a photon of this energy difference.
